column4: urgent help needed. I'm stuck in recovery mode. An upgrade has screwed up. Can someone please tell me how to reset apt-get as currently I cant install dbus.
anyone?
what do you mean by reset apt-get?
I cant install because of dependency issues.
what is the missing dependency?
the error I get is this (if you could google as solution I would be grateful) "dbus-uuidgen:symbol lookup error: /usr/bin/dbus-uuidgen:undefined symbol: dbus_internal:do_not_use_get_uuid
hadrun, and you are trying to reinstall dbus, correct?
nothing from google btw
rats. Any ideas?
hadrun, you could download the package and install it manually, and force if needed, but you should probably uninstall and then reinstall rather then force.
what do I need to do? I have only command line here.
you are attempting to install dbus, correct?
or reinstall it
yes. Or that is whats causing the rest of the install to abort. I need to force a reinstall of dbus,
is this feisty or an older version?
feisty
and your system arch, x86, amd64, etc?
joe:ifconfig
I just sent you a msg with information and a direct link to that package
I got nothing.
if you could public post the wget line to get the package I would be grateful
wget http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/d/dbus/dbus_1.0.2-1ubuntu3_i386.deb
my msg did not go through because my nick was not registered =/
